reviews.review_msg: AR is a great lecturer and has a deep knowledge of the history of Islam. He clearly has a lot of passion for the Islamic intellectual history and the history of Iran. His lectures are full of information and he often jokes during them. He answers questions in-depth and he makes class very relaxed and chill; be prepared for heavy note taking though

AR is the best prof I have ever had. He genuinely cares so much about his students and will do everything he can to help you succeed. His lectures were super informative and engaging. I learned so much stuff in his class and would 100% recommend any course he teaches

His lectures display interest and deep knowledge but his slides are not helpful at all. You have to make notes while he gives lecture which is pretty hard. However, the AR is very friendly and his Office Hours help you fill the gap. However, his worst part is his marking. It's really hard to score an A grade.
His notes are really dry and there's nothing on them. Lots of boring textbook reading. Personally, I wouldn't take a class with him. Tough grader.
Trash. For real though. Dry lectures. Be prepared to listen to him talk. No information on his slides beside some pictures. Tough marker. Would not take it with him again.
Knowledgeable, interesting, and very nice.
No Comments

Great Prof!  No need to read text just write down everything he says and memorize it and you will def. get an A! I bet the other commenters did not even take many notes in class and just studied the text!

knows alot about what he teaches, and likes to use lots of unnecessary foreign terminology and convoluted academic speak in order to prove it. does not make his subject matter accessible. avoid him if possible.

Highly recommend recording all lectures since he speaks for 2 hours non-stop. The book is useful if you're planning on receiving a B+, A-, or A because it is very consistent with Dr. DM's opinions and lectures. Otherwise it is not a difficult course. I've never seen any prof as polite and as reasonable as him.
Very difficult class, wouldn't recommend.
One of the hardest classes I've taken at university... interesting, but really difficult.

He is really difficult to understand for all of you that say he's a great speaker he is not. Beware! he does not make sense and his lectures are incoherent. he is not helpful wit his assingments either i went to him more then one n told him i was struggling n he offered no help! i was forced to jus stop going to his class. AVOID AT ALL COST!

An excellent Prof who knows EVERYTHING about Islam.  Expectations for the course are fair, but the Hodgson textbook is useless.  His choice of TA ont he other hand is atrocious.  A useless imbecile who couldnt care less about the subject matter, or showing up to tutorials.

I don't think I've ever had a professor who knows as much about his subject as MacLean. Lectures can be a little convoluted; he tends to go on tangents that don't directly involve the course material. However, he is extremely informative and an all around great professor.

Very passionate. Good speaker. Great topic. MacLean is a very fair marker. 2 probs though. The Hodgson textbook is useless, too abstract for a survey course. And he's always behind in lectures. Tests were fair, expectations for the paper were rather vague, start planning ahead, 1001 nights. Would definitely recommend MacLean and the course.
He knew his stuff and you can tell that he is extremely interested in the subject. However, he is very unclear regarding assignments and what direction you should be following.
Great prof.
Interesting stories.

Not an easy class, but MacLean is an interesting and compelling lecturer who also makes good use of time. Tends to go over class time, but is very fair about marking and material that he tests on. No real need to read or even buy the textbook(Hodgson), but missing lectures is a really bad idea.
Very nice man.  Knows his stuff!  The TA was great.  The text was garbage.

MacLean is a great teacher. Interesting (though difficult lectures). The kind of prof that I could listen to for hours. Skim the readings if you must, though the lectures go over everything that would be covered on a test. Reccomended only for those who are REALLY interested in Islamic History.
The book is useless and hard to read. Just study the notes and you'll nail this class. Despite all the noise me and my friends made he never complained so he gets extra marks for that too.
My favorite prof . If you are at all interested in history, take his courses!
Knows his stuff-makes it so interesting. Taught all basics of Islam.
